newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Robotics continues modem-backed climb.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Robotics continues modem-backed climb.

text.p: U.S. Robotics Corp jumped to its highest level in more than a month Thursday as expectations grew that the company would have a faster modem on the market by the end of the year.

The Skokie, Illinois-based modem maker will not comment on whether it is close to shipping a 56 kilobits bits per second modem. But though Rockwell International Corp's semiconductor unit said earlier this week it expects to demonstrate 56 kilobit transmission capabilities at a trade show in November, analysts think U.S. Robotics, with a dominant modem market position, will still be quicker to ship a faster modem.
"My sense is (U.S. Robotics) probably (will ship by) the end of this year, but I think the others will take a little longer," said Amar Senan, analyst at Volpe, Welty.
John Grangaard, analyst at GS2 Securities, said this could give U.S. Robotics months of lead time on its competition.
"I'm expecting U.S. Robotics to have a product in the fourth calendar quarter," he said. "They could have anything from a six to 12 months lead time on the competition."
U.S. Robotics was up 4-5/8 to 61-3/8 Thursday with 6.3 million shares traded.
